metadata.title: CVE-2021-46993 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: sched:Fix out-of-bound access in uclamp Util-clamp places tasks in differentbuckets based on their clamp values for performance reasons. However, thesize of buckets is currently computed using a rounding division, which canlead to an off-by-one error in some configurations. For instance, with 20buckets, the bucket size will be 1024/20=51. A task with a clamp of 1024will be mapped to bucket id 1024/51=20. Sadly, correct indexes are in range[0,19], hence leading to an out of bound memory access. Clamp the bucket idto fix the issue.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
